g.text: 24. Morice, C. P., Kennedy, J. J., Rayner, N. A. & Jones,P. D. Quantifying uncertainties in global and regional temperature change using
an ensemble of observational estimates: The HadCRUT4 dataset.
25. Kuhlbrodt, T. & Gregory, G. M. Ocean heat uptake and its consequences for the magnitude of sea level rise and climate change.
Sea Level Change, in Climate Change 2013: The Physical Science Basis. Contribution of Working Group I to the Fifth
Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change
27. World Climate Research Program, Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 5 (CMIP5). NCAS British Atmospheric Data
28. Yu, L. & Weller, R. A. Objectively analyzed air-sea flux fields for the global ice-free oceans (1981–2005).
29. Huffman, G. J., Adler, R. F., Bolvin, D. T. & Gu, G. Improving the global precipitation record: GPCP version 2.1.
30. Dai, A., Qian, T., Trenberth, K. E. & Milliman, J. D. Changes in continental fresh water discharge from 1948 to 2004.
31. Large, W. & Yeager, S. The global climatology of an interannually varying air–sea flux dataset.
32. Xie, P. & Arkin, P. A. Global precipitation: a 17-year monthly analysis based on gauge observations, satellite estimates, and numerical
33. Ivancic, T. J. & Shaw, S. B. A U.S.-based analysis of the ability of the Clausius-Clapeyron relationship to explain changes in extreme
This work is part of the UK Natural Environment Research Council funded project. CLimate scale analysis of
Air and Water masses (CLAW), grant NE/K012932/1. We acknowledge the World Climate Research Program’s
Working Group on Coupled Modeling, which is responsible for CMIP5, and we thank the climate modelling
groups for producing and making available their model output. We acknowledge the Research Data Archive at
the National Center for Atmospheric Research, Computational and Information Systems Laboratory, for making
available the freshwater flux datasets. We thank P.J. Durack for his comments on the manuscript.
N.S. and J.D.Z. designed the study and analysed the data. N.S. and J.D.Z. wrote the initial draft of the manuscript
with substantial contributions from G.N., S.A.J. and R.M. All authors discussed and interpreted the results and
The authors declare no competing financial interests.
Global water cycle amplifying at less than the Clausius-Clapeyron rate.
